data.title: Crash in RasterizerSceneGLES3::_render_geometry [Intel HD 3000, OSX]
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mac OS X 10.11.6
Godot 3.0 latest master
Intel HD Graphics 3000

**Issue description:**
Was trying the latest master with the Window Management demo, it ran once and then started crashing everytime I tried to run it again.
I've attached the crash log and the console output.

[ConsoleOut.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1181946/ConsoleOut.txt)
[Crash.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1181941/Crash.txt)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Run the Window Management demo.

**Link to minimal example project:**
Use the Window Management demo.

data.title: fix missing DEFVAL
data.body: closes #9798

data.title: Impossible to select again an audio effect if there is only one
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1
Windows 10 64 bits

Repro steps:
1) Have only one audio bus
2) Have only one effect in this bus
3) Select the effect, notice you see the inspector correctly show effect properties
4) Select a node or some other resource, notice the audio effect is still shown highlighted
5) Try to click again the effect, notice nothing happens, the inspector doesn't show effect properties anymore, until you delete the effect or add a second one.

data.title: Gizmos aren't Z-sorted properly with transparent surfaces
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1 official
Windows 10 64 bits
nVidia geforce 940M

It depends on the viewing angle, gizmos get randomly drawn behind or in front of transparent surfaces. In the screenshot, the blue plane is slightly transparent:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/28696480-17c1c18c-7336-11e7-986c-f0f9b7ae971c.png)

data.title: Transform change dialog has wrong sizing
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1 official
Windows 10 64 bits

In the Transform menu, open `Transform dialog..`:
Notice the combo box has a very tall size.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/28696406-a0878c46-7335-11e7-9108-cc80fee14b06.png)

data.title: Distance fog isn't world-space
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1 official
Windows 10 64 bits

In Godot 2.1.3, distance fog was distance based, so when looking around it didn't change the color of a given object seen far away as long as you stay where you are, no matter where you look at.

In 3.0 objects in fog suddenly become more visible depending on where you look at. It looks a bit messy on some fog setups that are usually fine in distance-based versions:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TwkdifkfbyE&feature=youtu.be

data.title: improvement suggestions for godot(3) gui
data.body:
Suggestions for improvement

1) **[context menu to load ressource]** change click area after selecting (fix: #10238, #9052)
![context_menu_to_load_ressource](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10463138/28689931-ad6c15d0-7317-11e7-853f-74f035e0945d.gif)
**Suggestion:** click area should be same size before and after selecting
2) button too narrow to open the menu (fix #10006)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10463138/28690547-df651166-7319-11e7-9235-171bb7e44cc1.png)
3) red (error) message when pressed on [new project] button (confusing as novice)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10463138/28690796-d06dc4fe-731a-11e7-8cf5-cee029e13864.png)
**Suggestion:** Give hint that default project path is empty and can be set on editor setting
4) selecting script language don't change file extension(Path) automatic and give error message (fix #10006)
![script_file_extension](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10463138/28691348-ea9ba77c-731c-11e7-855b-4a65deae4bea.gif)
5) tree point behave different
![tree_points](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10463138/28691921-db18b2e8-731e-11e7-9467-ccb6c05cdbce.gif)
6) editor settings don't show icon to reset to default (PR: #11564)
![reset_icon](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10463138/28692365-8e2bf63c-7320-11e7-9f5c-4949e78fb91e.gif)

I hope there are not to much for one issue. Thanks for all the cool new g3 improvement.

data.title: Godot tries to reimport failed files
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3.0 alpha

**Issue description:**
When a file fails to import, Godot will try to reimport it every time it is refocused. This can be very annoying sometimes. Also, #8461 would help a lot.

**Steps to reproduce:**
* Add an invalid file to the project (such as an empty ,png).
* Unfocus and refocus the editor.

data.title: Cannot save 3D Scenes due to Alert: Requested file format unknown. Both Collada and Wavefront meshes.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3.0 latest master build: 246b574
Manjaro Linux 17.0.2 64-bit

**Issue description:**
Upon saving a 3D Scene with emmision materials, An alert is displayed, and the scene cannot be saved.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Simply create a 3D scene and try to save it. Also happens when running the game.
![deepinscreenshot_select-area_20170727163035](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28677151/28691939-9f5ccf0a-72ec-11e7-9189-3baefa6f83fc.png)

data.title: Partial regression: missing audio-related signals.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 17.04 64-bit. Godot version 3.0 pull 3c53b35.

**Issue description:**
AudioStreamPlayer lacks signals related to audio files starting, stopping,etc. 2.1.x had at least a signal for StreamPlayer which indicated when its stream finished. Both 2D and 3D versions of AudioStreamPlayer also lack any such signals.

Names could be something like "stream_started", "stream_looped" etc.

data.title: Painted tiles have duplicated rows and lines
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Desktop PC, Win 10, Godot_v3.0-alpha1_win64

**Issue description:**
When painting tiles the second last row and line are duplicated and show up as last row and last line (instead of proper last line and row).

Screenshot of the Problem: http://www.mythos-games.com/screenshot.png
(visible not only in editor viewport but also in running game)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Starting a project with following settings (i have not tried other settings):

Rendering - Quality - 2d - Use Pixel Snap: on
Display - Window - Mode: viewport
Display - Window - Viewport: keep

- make a scene
- add node 
- do as often as you like: add sprite as child to node, give it a unique name, add texture to sprite (no filtering, no mipmaps, etc.), set region to true, define region in region editor
- save scene
- convert scene to TileSet

- make a second scene
- add Node
- add Tilemap as child to Node
- sdd created Tileset
- set Cell-Size to needed value (in this case the tiles are 16,16)
- set Cell-Quadrant size to 16
- paint tiles


**Link to minimal example project:**
http://www.mythos-games.com/example.zip

data.title: Thread does not start with a method with no arguments
data.body:
**ElementaryOS** 0.4.1 (Ubuntu 17) - Godot version: 2.1.3

Thread does not start with a method with no arguments
This node works:
``` gdscript
extends Node
var thread = null

func _ready():
	thread = Thread.new()
	var err = thread.start(self, "work")

func work(userdata):
    print("oi")
    while(true):
        print("oi")
```

But this does not:
```gdscript
extends Node

var thread = null



func _ready():
	thread = Thread.new()
	var err = thread.start(self, "work")

func work():
    print("oi")
    while(true):
        print("oi")

```

I found this error during my question (https://godotengine.org/qa/16730/thread-not-running), but only by adding the argument did the method start to run.

data.title: Raycast2D not colliding with tile
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Microsoft Windows Education Version	10.0.14393
Godot_v2.1.4-beta_20170625_win64

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
`is_colliding()` method of Raycast2D returns false when a tile is in a TileMap


**Steps to reproduce:**

I made a tileset following this tutorial : [http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/learning/features/2d/using_tilemaps.html](url) 
The raycast keeps on returning false when it should be hitting a tile from the tilemap, but gives the expected result when the tile is directly in the scene.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[raycast2D_tilemap.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1180643/raycast2D_tilemap.zip)
I made a tile, and put one in the tilemap using a tileset, and the other directly in the scene.
You can swap the direction of the raycast between the tiles by pressing space. (enable visible collision shapes in the debug option to see where the raycast is pointing)
The console is printing the result of `is_colliding()` in  `_fixed_process`.

data.title: Fix Android debug/run (2.1)
data.body:
Same as _master_'s 0ae3336a329b1fd14b66bb26707c2461b66e5aa8; namely:
- Prefix all __adb__ commands with device specification to avoid errors when multiple devices connected.
- Include Android release in device data collection.
- Force system user:.
    - Ability to enable/disable.
    - Apply only if OS release >= 17 (when multiuser was introduced.
    - Fix argument passing.
- Rename local variable `port` to `dbg_port` to better match its partner `fs_port`.
- Fix typo in error message.

But adds:
- Get the debug port from the editor settings, where it lives now.

Fixes #8581.

data.title: Fix Android debug/run
data.body:
- Prefix all __adb__ commands with device specification to avoid errors when multiple devices connected.
- Include Android release in device data collection.
- Force system user:.
    - Ability to enable/disable.
    - Apply only if OS release >= 17 (when multiuser was introduced.
    - Fix argument passing.
- Rename local variable `port` to `dbg_port` to better match its partner `fs_port`.
- Fix typo in error message.

data.title: added old_tab to Tabs
data.body:
I am not sure about the -1 solution but since it is not used anyway it should be fine.

closes #9799

data.title: Ability to add Metadata via Node Menu
data.body:
Currently, Metadata can only be added via scripts via set_meta()
It would be a huge enhancement for usability if Metadata could be set via the Node Menu simlarly to Groups.
![node menu groups](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20967774/28676186-e8c1651c-72e1-11e7-8e3b-289f9062de6a.png)

data.title: Unshaded models aren't sorted correctly.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bit - Godot 3.0 Alpha 1

**Issue description:**
If a material is set to unshaded it will not sort correctly. Here are some screenshots.
The 3D Platformer demo:
![](http://i.imgur.com/J787MWR.png)

My own model:
![](http://i.imgur.com/W3Qsxv4.png)

What the model looks like with shading, being rendered correctly:
![](http://i.imgur.com/yPlS8A3.png)

While testing I noticed that the issue with unshaded materials is the same problem that the "On Top" option has, I don't know how related this is:
![](http://i.imgur.com/H4xuKIM.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
The materials of the player and enemies in the 3D platformer demo can be set to unshaded to reproduce this effect.

data.title: Add missing max. number of samples (MSAA) check
data.body:
Fixes #9908.
OpenGL ref - [glRenderbufferStorageMultisample](https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL-Refpages/gl4/html/glRenderbufferStorageMultisample.xhtml)

data.title: OpenGL error: GL_INVALID_OPERATION error generated. Texture name does not refer to a texture object generated by OpenGL. [nvidia, Windows]
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1 official
Windows 10 64 bits
nVidia

I got this error a little while after the import process, and it started spamming every frame when I "Open anyways" an obj that was imported as a scene:
```
ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL        Type: Error     ID: 1282        Severity: High  Message: GL_INVALID_OPERATION error generated. Texture name does not refer to a texture object generated by OpenGL.
   At: drivers\gles3\rasterizer_gles3.cpp:123
mesege
```

It started spamming only after a few attempts to open obj files that were imported as scenes (same project as in #9910)

data.title: [NativeScript] fixed optional _init call
data.body:
In 3c53b35 a call to an "_init" function was introduced,
that however was only executed in the `_new` function,
also it *required* that such a function exists.

With this patch the "_init" function will be optionally called on
every instance creation.

data.title: Tilemap flickering at times
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, godot3.0alpha1

**Issue description:**
I made a kinematicbody2D and a tilemap, moving the kinematic body around worked as normal however occasionally one of the tiles on the tilemap would vanish faster than any screen recording software could capture. sometimes 2 would vanish, they would get redrawn however


**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a tilemap, load some tiles in, make a kinematic body
move the body around the game, keep your eyes open, dont blink, watch as some tiles vanish from rendering and quickly come back

data.title: Sub Viewports don't render anything
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 64bit - Godot 3.0 alpha1

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Sub Viewports don't render anything.

**Steps to reproduce:**
-Create new project
-Add Control node and resize it so its visible in the game
-Add Viewport node to the Control node
-Add Something to the Viewport node, e.g. a Button
-Launch the game. The Button should be visible, but isn't.

data.title: [NativeScript] fix mutex double lock
data.body:
In 3c53b35 a bug got introduced where a mutex gets locked twice
instead of locked and then unlocked.
This path fixes that.

data.title: Cannot use .obj files as meshes after opening a project in vanilla setup
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1 official
Windows 10 64 bits

I ran Godot 3.0 for the first time on a new PC, and opened the project I linked here for the first time: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1178454/Test3.zip 
(same working project as an earlier issue https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/9899#issuecomment-318240670)

For some reason, assets got re-imported even though there was an import folder already.
Then I realized the main scene wasn't showing any mesh anymore. All MeshInstances' `mesh` properties were set to `null`. 
I tried to create a new scene, add a MeshInstance, but I was unable to choose any obj file. When I click on them in the inspector, I am shown this message:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/28670706-d3d45d72-72d1-11e7-994a-fb4c28ca58df.png)
These meshes are not scenes, they are... just meshes. I don't want to create scenes out of importing them.
So I went to the Import dock and noticed I could only import it as a scene Oo
What is going on?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/28670784-1ea10d78-72d2-11e7-836c-d2a574ae826e.png)

Edit: the only way I could assign meshes back was to go into the .import folder and choose meshes from there instead of the obj file.

data.title: firsts docs for CollisionObject -> collision shape api
data.body: As far as I can tell this is how it works. Hope those initial docs will be enough for people to start using this api.
